intro: Mulinum echegarayi, commonly known as the Echegaray's mullein, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Chile. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is known for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses including treating respiratory ailments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
